info.title: Resource Inventory Management
info.description: This is Swagger UI environment generated for the TMF Resource Inventory Management specification

get.description: This operation list or find Resource entities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

X-Result-Count.description: Actual number of items returned in the response body

X-Total-Count.description: Total number of items matching criteria

post.description: This operation creates a Resource entity.

get.description: This operation retrieves a Resource entity. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to provide in response

patch.description: This operation updates partially a Resource entity.

delete.description: This operation deletes a Resource entity.

get.description: This operation list or find PhysicalResource entities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

X-Result-Count.description: Actual number of items returned in the response body

X-Total-Count.description: Total number of items matching criteria

post.description: This operation creates a PhysicalResource entity.

get.description: This operation retrieves a PhysicalResource entity. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to provide in response

patch.description: This operation updates partially a PhysicalResource entity.

delete.description: This operation deletes a PhysicalResource entity.

get.description: This operation list or find LogicalResource entities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

X-Result-Count.description: Actual number of items returned in the response body

X-Total-Count.description: Total number of items matching criteria

post.description: This operation creates a LogicalResource entity.

get.description: This operation retrieves a LogicalResource entity. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to provide in response

put.description: This operation updates a LogicalResource entity.

patch.description: This operation updates partially a LogicalResource entity.

delete.description: This operation deletes a LogicalResource entity.

post.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Data containing the callback endpoint to deliver the information

delete.description: Resets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the registered listener

post.description: Example of a client listener for receiving the notification ResourceCreateEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification ResourceAttributeValueChangeEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification ResourceStateChangeEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification ResourceDeleteEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification PhysicalResourceCreateEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification PhysicalResourceAttributeValueChangeEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification PhysicalResourceStateChangeEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification PhysicalResourceDeleteEvent

Attachment.description: Complements the description of an element (for instance a product) through video, pictures...

id.description: Unique identifier for this particular attachment

attachmentType.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

content.description: The actual contents of the attachment object, if embedded, encoded as base64

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

mimeType.description: Attachment mime type such as extension file for video, picture and document

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

validFor.description: The period of time for which the attachment is valid

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

AttachmentRef.description: Attachment reference. An attachment complements the description of an element (for instance a product) through video, pictures

href.description: URL serving as reference for the attachment resource

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

LogicalResource.description: Logic resource is a type of resource that describes the common set of attributes shared by all concrete logical resources (e.g. TPE, MSISDN, IP Addresses) in the inventory.

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

category.description: Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

endOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date till the resource is operating

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

resourceVersion.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource.

startOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date from which the resource is operating

value.description: the value of the logical resource. E.g '0746712345' for  MSISDN's

administrativeState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

operationalState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

resourceStatus.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

usageState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

PhysicalResource.description: Physical resource is a type of resource that describes the common set of attributes shared by all concrete physical resources (e.g. EQUIPMENT) in the inventory.

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

category.description: Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

endOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date till the resource is operating

manufactureDate.description: This is a string attribute that defines the date of manufacture of this item in the fixed format "dd/mm/yyyy". This is an optional attribute.

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

powerState.description:
This defines the current power status of the hardware item. Values include:

  0:  Unknown
  1:  Not Applicable
  2:  No Power Applied
  3: Full Power Applied
  4:  Power Save - Normal
  5:  Power Save - Degraded
  6:  Power Save - Standby
  7:  Power Save - Critical
  8:  Power Save - Low Power Mode
  9:  Power Save - Unknown
 10: Power Cycle
 11: Power Warning
 12: Power Off

resourceVersion.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource.

serialNumber.description: This is a string that represents a manufacturer-allocated number used to identify different instances of the same hardware item. The ModelNumber and PartNumber attributes are used to identify different types of hardware items. This is a REQUIRED attribute.

startOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date from which the resource is operating

versionNumber.description: This is a string that identifies the version of this physical resource. This is an optional attribute.

administrativeState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

operationalState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

resourceStatus.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.

usageState.description: Tracks the lifecycle status of the resource, such as planning, installing, opereating, retiring and so on.
